text:
My friends and family are coming over for 
the ultimate picnic and for dessert a dreamy

light tangerine drizzle cake. It's a play on the 
classic lemon drizzle cake but you can do it with

tangerines, oranges, grapefruit. So I've got a pack 
of butter, 250 grams that goes in. Then I'm going

to go in with 250 grams of self-raising flour. 
Then I'm going to go in with 250 grams of honey

and this honey is from my bees so I'm 
very excited to use it. I'm then going

to add 200 grams of ground almonds. A nice 
pinch of salt and then we're going to go in

with one tablespoon of vanilla paste, it's 
extract and I'm going to put the zest of two

tangerines into this and then once you've zested 
that I'll just put this tangerine aside because

we'll use the actual fruit later when we garnish 
this gorgeous cake. The only ingredient I've got to

add now is my eggs. So six large organic eggs 
go in. All you you have to do now is whack it on

and then sometimes I just give 
it a little wipe round the sides.

Done. Okay, so before we put it into our 
bundt tin... that little remnants of butter

from my butter pack, just get that or olive oil 
around the outside of the dish. So in our bundt

now just pour it in. The vanilla, the zest 
smells amazing. Now it goes in the oven at

180° celsius which is 350° fahrenheit 
and it will cook for about 30 to 35 minutes.

So probably the most important part maybe is 
the drizzle you know. If you're having a lemon

drizzle cake, what's the best bit? The drizzle. So 
I've got 100 grams of icing sugar here. I'm just

going to mix in some tangerine juice. Let's put 
a half in and see how well we go because you'd

be amazed how little we need. Let's just 
stir that in. And actually this cake does

not work without this on top. Really, really 
nice. And that will be my portable topping.

Delicious. So I've got my little kit here, 
slices, zest, the icing. Check that out.

So the cake has had just over 30 minutes and 
it's looking very ,very nice. Smells are amazing

Look at that. Look what's really nice is it's 
golden, it's soft. So let that cool down for

about half an hour and then we can put it 
back in the tin and the tin will protect

it when we're transporting it around and all 
that stuff... it''s gonna be amazing, happy days

That is absolutely gorgeous. 
So nice. It's lovely to see you
